definition: to be content with one's lot (idiom)/to know one's place
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: They treated their servants well, but expected them always to know their place.
sentences.chinese: 他們對待僕人不壞，但期望他們時時安分守己。

sentences.english: She was one of the most unoffending little countries in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 比利時是歐洲最安分守己的小國之一。

sentences.english: How much love can come back again, how many people are waiting, steady.
sentences.chinese: 有多少愛可以重來，有多少人值得等待，安分守己。

sentences.english: In another fashion I too was to hold still .
sentences.chinese: 我也得用另一種方式表現得安分守己。

sentences.english: No matter who doesn't follow the rules, hewould be criticized by the public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 無論是誰不安分守己都要被社會輿論批評。

sentences.english: We could all have settled down then, minding our own business, and I'd have let bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 原說下接過來大家安分守己的，我也不提舊事了。

definition: decorous/respectable
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
to stir up trouble
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to carry out official duties and observe the law
honest/sincere/well-behaved/open and guileless/naive
to live together in harmony
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to stand aloof from worldly affairs
to idle about
to have no aspirations (idiom)/unambitious
to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
